title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 May 2009 - XWiki
content:
kraze joined #xwiki at 00:02  
lucaa left at 00:10 ("Leaving.")  
rrodriguez left at 00:23 ()  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:31): When using the Export feature.  what do I input for the "Package Name"?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:31): Whatever you want  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:31): You can leave it empty  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:31): and what exactly does this import?  All of my wiki pages?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:31): It's the name of the generated file  
anamarias left at 00:31 ()  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:31): Export exports, doesn't import  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:31): And yes, it exports all the pages  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:32): sweet!  Thanks, sdumitriu!  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:32): If you want to select what you want to export, use this: http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/ImportExportApplicationDownload  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:32): so once I export this from, say, 1.4.1, I can re-import it into 1.8.2?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:33): Yes  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:33): alrighty, then!  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:33): moment of truth awaits  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:35): But after that you should import the new default XE xar, to have the wiki improvements, careful not to override critical documents (like XWiki.Admin, XWiki.XWikiPreference and XWiki.XWikiAllGroup)  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:49): sdumitriu: you're referring to the xwiki-enterprise-xwiki-1.8.2.xar, correct?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:49): Yes  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:49): you recommend doing this \*after\* importing my own XAR?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:51): Yes  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:51): Your xar contains old documents  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:51): ok  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:51): danke  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:52): Bitte schon  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:53): when going from 1.4.1 to 1.8.2, should I bring 1.8.2 up with a blank database?  I'm getting these errors: isDiff: Patch is inconsistent. Content and diff field are contradicting  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:53): What database are you using?  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:53): mysql  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:54): Try with a clean database  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:54): How many documents do you have in your wiki?  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:54): ok  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 00:54): Important: ALWAYS backup your data first  
kraze - (05/05/2009 00:56): yep, I've been learning that throughout my upgrade from 0.9.840  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:20): Maximum Upload Size - is the value for this in B,b,Kb,KB,Mb,MB?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 01:20): B  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:20): thanks  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 01:20): You will need tons of RAM if you're uploading a large file  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 01:20): How large is it?  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:21): 42MB  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 01:22): Then you should give the server at least 1.2G of RAM  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 01:22): -Xmx1500m  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:22): what's the formula for this calculation?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 01:22): ~ \*27  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 01:22): It's a known problem with attachment handling  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:22): I think the max value for -Xmx is 1024 according to tomcat docs  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 01:22): No, there's no maximum  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:22): which is what I have it set as  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:22): ahh  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:22): it seems to have uploaded ok  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 01:23): OK  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:23): hmm, when I click on the attached xar, it's not expanding  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:23): I had this problem with an earlier version and had to use IE  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:23): ahh, nevermind, it just took some time to expand  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:24): patience is a virtue  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:25): [Lucene index updating thread] [Lucene Index Updater] ERROR lucene.IndexUpdater             - error deleting doc 1315  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:25): should I be concerned about that?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 01:26): No  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:27): heh, good... 'cause a bunch of them just spewed into my catalina.out  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:27): 487 docs installed, 1 skipped.  looks like a fairly good success rate  
kraze - (05/05/2009 01:42): hmm, so after that import, I go to my home page and see a ton of folders, each on their individual lines, and a link to each.  this appear to be my spaces that were more cleanly organized in previous versions of XWiki.  a lot of them have an icon of a blue square with a white questionmark in it.  when I click on said links, there's no wiki data  
tharindu left at 02:42 (Remote closed the connection)  
kraze - (05/05/2009 03:18): rolled back to 1.4.1 for now.  when I import the default XAR (except for XWiki.Admin, XWiki.XWikiPreference, XWiki.XWikiAllGroup, XWiki.XWikiAdminGroup), my main page is replaced with the default.  what shouldn't I import to prevent this?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 03:18): Main.WebHome  
kraze - (05/05/2009 03:19): thanks  
kraze - (05/05/2009 03:19): you're the most advanced AI I've ever dealt with  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:07): is there a way to have a table without the title columns or have title columns blank?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:08): In XWIki 1.0 syntax no  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:08): In 2.0, yes  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:08): interesting  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:08): fair enough  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:08): By default 2.0 does not have headers, but any cell can be made into one  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:08): See the table syntax on the Syntax page  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:09): I have quite a few tables in my old wiki that didn't have them.  after upgrading to 1.4.2 and beyond, this breaks those tables and puts a "table: null" error in its place.  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:10): I'll see how well the 2.0 converter works against these tables later ;-)  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:10): I don't know if that's the cause  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:11): The 1.0 syntax always had the first row as headers  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:11): But the null error has nothing to do with headers  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:11): the tables begin with | | | to give them blank title columns.  if I fill those with data, the tables appear  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:11): Do you have formulas in the table?  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:12): nope, mostly links  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:13): "Useful links" types.. so that these links do not span pages and pages worth of lines with only a few words or less per line  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:14): s/types/within tables  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:15): So this might be a real problem...  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:15): these tables were working up to 1.4.1.  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:15): Can you create an issue on jira.xwiki.org and paste such a table?  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:15): sure  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:20): I just tested it on Netcipia and it works ok  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:20): perhaps this is a bug that has already been addressed.  do you still want me to file a bug report?  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:20): http://syntax.netcipia.net/xwiki/bin/preview/Main/WebHome?section=1  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:21): Yes, reproduced the null problem locally  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:21): ok  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:22): XWiki Core?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:22): Yes  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:22): Rendering 1.0  
kraze - (05/05/2009 04:24): can I use {code} in the description?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 04:27): Use {noformat}  
sdumitriu left at 04:34 ("Leaving.")  
kraze left at 05:08 ("If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.")

rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 13:15  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 13:15): Hi rrodriguez  
rrodriguez - (05/05/2009 13:15): Hi sdumitriu!  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 13:16): How are you?  
rrodriguez - (05/05/2009 13:16): glad to read you here again! and to be myself on the XWiki track again as well!  
rrodriguez - (05/05/2009 13:16): how are you doing?  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 13:16): Fine, fine  
sdumitriu - (05/05/2009 13:17): Fixing issues  
rrodriguez - (05/05/2009 13:17): as usual!  
rrodriguez - (05/05/2009 13:17): I've been yesterday afternoon trying a brand new installation. I am afraid I will need some days/weeks to catch up!  
rrodriguez - (05/05/2009 13:18): XWiki has improved a lot and I can see many new features!  
rrodriguez - (05/05/2009 13:20): I do hope to be useful to the community again. And to draw some business having XWiki as solid rock foundation! :-)

vmassol - (05/05/2009 15:24): nice video jvelociter !  
jvelociter - (05/05/2009 15:24): thanks  
jvelociter - (05/05/2009 15:25): maybe vimeo is not the best host for the documentation, I'll look upload it directly on the page  
vmassol - (05/05/2009 15:25): it's fine I think  
jvelociter - (05/05/2009 15:25): ok  
vmassol - (05/05/2009 15:25): actually it help spread the xwiki name  
jvelociter - (05/05/2009 15:25): then we need a XWiki accuont there  
jvelociter - (05/05/2009 15:27): I'll create it next time  
jvelociter - (05/05/2009 15:27): (I have another XWiki video waiting in line)  
glerouge - (05/05/2009 15:32): jvelociter: use the usual credentials  
jvelociter - (05/05/2009 15:32): yes  
jvelociter - (05/05/2009 15:32): username : Admin, pass: admin ;)  
glerouge - (05/05/2009 15:33): lol
